section.condition: TITLE=Trade Services: Export Letter Of Credit;PERM=el_access
section.para: An Export Letter of Credit (EL) or Documentary Credit is a banking mechanism that enables importers to offer secure terms to exporters. It is an undertaking given by a bank (the Issuing Bank) on behalf of the buyer (applicant) to pay a seller (beneficiary) a given amount of money on presentation of specified documents guaranteeing the supply of goods within specific time limits. These documents, conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit, are to be presented at a specified place. This EL is raised by a bank for approval by an applicant from a third party.

Whereas the Import Letter of Credit module provides an interface for the applicant to request a Letter of Credit, this module (EL) provides an interface for the beneficiary to receive and follow up a Letter of Credit.

This module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the exporter and beneficiary), to receive notification of Letters of Credit, and subsequent amendments or updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval in the ongoing transaction flow, or to initiate a transfer.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "EL", "Letter Of Credit", "Export EL", and "Export Letter of Credit" are used interchangeably.

section.title: Export Letter of Credit - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Export Letter of Credit function, from the toolbar, select Trade Services > Export Letter of Credit.

section.title: Export Letter of Credit Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. There is no Amendment group of functions.

listitem.para: As the primary beneficiary, transfer in full or partially a Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary.
Send a free-format message to the Advising Bank. A typical use of this feature would be for you as the exporter to indicate your consent to an amendment request sent by the applicant.
View all existing Export Letters of Credit, that are not yet complete..
Display lists of existing Export Letters of Credit, according to specific search criteria.

section.title: Transfer and Assignment
section.para: This section describes the Transfer and Assignment part of the menu and the forms it uses.

This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Export Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is guaranteed to receive payment provided he satisfies the terms laid down in the transfer credit, irrespective of the actions of your own company, the main beneficiary. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the transfer.

Once complete, you can assign part of the proceeds that you expect to receive under an existing Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary. This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Export Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is only paid when your company, the main beneficiary, receives funds under the Letter of Credit. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the assignment.

section.para:
This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to initiate a transfer of an Export Letter of Credit.
Transfer

section.title: Transfer Form - Licenses
section.para: Click on the Link License button and the List of licenses appears. Use System ID and License Number fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Secondary Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the transfer expiry date for the EL from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the transfer expiry date is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Transfer Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Transfer Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the transaction amount of the EL (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the transaction amount of the EL, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete
icon in the right-hand column.

section.title: Transfer and Assignment - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows a Transfer and Assignment record that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Transfer and Assignment records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Transfer and Assignment - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows the completion of a Transfer and Assignment record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit.

When selected, this option will present a list of Transfer and Assignment records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.
If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para: This part of the menu contains several options, providing different ways to send a free-format message to the Advising Bank.

Typical uses are to reply to notification of discrepancies on your documents presented to the Advising Bank, or to indicate that you accept an amendment to the terms of the underlying Letter of Credit initiated by the applicant.
From Existing EL
Displays a list of existing Export Letters of Credit, that is, Export Letters of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank.
Action Required
Displays any pending action required to complete the forms.
Generate Remittance Letter
Displays a list of approved ELs. You can generate and attach remittance letters to these ELs.
Edit Transactions
Review, complete and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank - Generate Remittance Letter
section.para: When this function is selected, you can view a list of export letters of credit and link a remittance letter to the available Standard ELs. The remittance letter is generated in PDF format and is a mandate for auto-approval of the EL transaction once the terms of the contract have been met. This negates the confirmation from the Bank's side to approve the payment and is solely dependent on the customer.

The auto-generated files are available in the list table on the page and you can download the documents in PDF form from here.

row.entry: This column shows the format (PDF) of the remittance letter for the EL.
This column shows the type of document (Remittance Letter) that has been attached to the EL
This column shows the file names of all the remittance letters for the EL

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows a Message to Bank record that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank record that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows the completion of a Message to Bank record that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit.

When selected, this option will present a list of Message to Bank record that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending ELs
section.para: This function will display a list of all Export Letters of Credit records that have not been approved to the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System ID or Applicant fields.
To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

There is a Download File button to download in CSV and Spreadsheet (MS Excel_ format. The columns returned in the list of Pending ELS are the following:
Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
Entity that made the export LC.
Type
The type of record. (New, etc.)
Status
The status of the EL. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
Applicant
The Export letter of credit applicant.
Input
The unique number used by the Customer for this EL.
Audit Trail
Click to view the details of user modifications in a popup.
Only Draft and Incomplete (unauthorised) entries can be edited by clicking the edit
icon in the left hand column of the entry.

Submitted entries may only be viewed using the View icon

section.title: EL Inquiry
section.para: This function will display a list of all Export Letters of Credit records that have been submitted to the bank and accepted. These can only be viewed.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System Id, Bank Ref., Applicant, or Ccy fields.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search.To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Export Letters of Credit are the following:

Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
Entity that made the export LC.
Bank Ref.
The reference number the bank uses to identify this letter of credit.
Applicant

Ccy
The Currency of the EL.
Amount
the amount of the EL.
Issue date
The date the EL was issued.
Status
The status of the EL. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
Click on the view
and history
icons on the left of each entry to view their details.

section.title: EL Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Export Letters of Credit records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: EL Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all LCs and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the LC by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: EL Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to an EL record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: EL Maintenance - Unsigned ELs
section.para: List and optionally delete Export Letters of Credit transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: EL Maintenance - Purged ELs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Export Letters of Credit records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
